proof.text: Let  be a minor straight line, and  commensurable with ; I say that  is also minor.
Let the same construction be made as before; then, since ,  are incommensurable in square, [elem.10.76] therefore ,  are also incommensurable in square. [elem.10.13]
Now since, as  is to , so is  to , [elem.5.12, elem.5.16] therefore also, as the square on  is to the square on , so is the square on  to the square on . [elem.6.22]
Therefore, , as the squares on ,  are to the square on , so are the squares on ,  to the square on . [elem.5.18]
But the square on  is commensurable with the square on ; therefore the sum of the squares on ,  is also commensurable with the sum of the squares on , . [elem.5.16, elem.10.11]
But the sum of the squares on ,  is rational; [elem.10.76] therefore the sum of the squares on ,  is also rational. [elem.10.def.4]

Again, since, as the square on  is to the rectangle , , so is the square on  to the rectangle , , while the square on  is commensurable with the square on , therefore the rectangle ,  is also commensurable with the rectangle , .

But the rectangle ,  is medial; [elem.10.76] therefore the rectangle ,  is also medial; [elem.10.23.p.1] therefore ,  are straight lines incommensurable in square which make the sum of the squares on them rational, but the rectangle contained by them medial.
Therefore  is minor. [elem.10.76] Q. E. D.
